name: The White Hart Country Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We came here after being disappointed at another pub in Hawes that we have visited over many years. However the meal here more than made up for it. We booked in the morning for the evening in the dining room, but the bar/lounge looked just as inviting. The food was first class and so was the service. The staff were very helpful and did not rush us at all. I would say it was value for money because most main course meals in the pubs in the area are around £10 or £11 and I think you pay for what you get and if that means good service and food then it's worth it. Would recommend this pub.
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: Came here for a meal out and what can I say!! From the moment we walked through the door to the moment we left everything was perfect!! The staff are super friendly couldn't do enough for you, tend to your every need! The food was Absolutly delicious I had the pork which was super tasty ate every last piece, my partner had the steak and ale pie which he also loved, the portions were just the right size! We then went on to have dessert which were very well presented and perfect for a person with a sweet tooth... Gorgeous!! Big thanks to pat and Julie in the kitchen another fabulous meal... Can't wait till next time!! :)
reviews.title: Excellent food and service!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited the White Hart twice to eat during our stay in Hawes. The food was fantastic and so was the service - very friendly and efficient staff. The Wensleydale Beef was absolutely delicious, as was the sea bass - the best I had ever had. Both the Bar and Restaurant are really cosy with a lovely atmosphere. Excellent value for money for food and drinks. Really looking forward to going back there when we visit Hawes again next year.
reviews.title: Excellent Food and Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: Had four very enjoyable meals. Would highly recommend this establishment.
reviews.title: Restaurant Hawes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four different meals from their specials and standard menu, all more than ample sizes and to the highest quality. I was impressed.
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We last visited the White Hart to eat in September 2010 and on that occasion vowed we would never return. It was more like a cross between a works canteen and a benefits hostel at that time.
reviews.title: First class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were intrigued to see it being refurbished last year and following the reviews on TA since the relaunch we decided to see for ourselves how things are now.
reviews.title: What a gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked early for the steak night and when we arrived on the Tuesday night we given a very friendly welcome by the staff on duty. I was worried that the White Hart might have been turned into a "gastro pub" but my fears were allayed when I saw the bar area still had a welcoming pub feel. Plenty of good local ales on tap including an excellent Carperby Calypso from the Yorkshire Dales Brewery. Although we went for the steak special the whole menu looked very good and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were shown into the restaurant by the friendly waitress and again the decor was in keeping. The old wood paneling had been retained giving a warm, cosy feel to the room.
reviews.title: Yorkshire hospitality at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the food, well the steaks were excellent, well presented and value for money. Unfortunately it was a wet and misty night and we had a trip back over the Buttertups to Muker to make so we declined a dessert but the menu looked inviting!
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was the first time I have visited the White Hart since the refurbishment. They've done a great job. The decor is clean and contemporary but retains the traditional feel.
reviews.title: Beer, Food and a touch of Yorkshire Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The choice and quality of beer was excellent.
reviews.title: Superb Yorkshire Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were there for the food; a party of 10 including the 'In-laws'. All well travelled and experienced restaurant users. The menu contained a good choice of dishes and the wine list was up to my wife's expectations (I stuck with the Salamander Bitter which was in fine form).
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The meal was simple in presentation (No pretentious silver service) but well cooked and certainly appreciated by everyone present. Better than your normal 'Pub Grub'.
reviews.title: Smashing Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am back in Hawes in December 2012 and I will be making a bee-line for the White Hart. The place seems popular with visitors and locals alike, a shooting party was present when we visited. If you are looking for a meal you would probably want to book in advance.
reviews.title: first class meal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed in Hawes for a few days, and ate in the White Hart twice. I would recommend booking for weekend meals as it is very popular. We booked for Saturday and only waited about 10 minutes for our table in the bar (otherwise I doubt we would have eaten for about 90 minutes!) We had garlic bread which was OK, and a good portion size. The for mains I had trio of fish and hubby had Cod loin. Both were beautifully cooked and arrived with crushed potatoes and delicious vegetables. Portions are not big, but food is delicious and very well presented.
reviews.title: Lovely Food, Warm Welcom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went back on Sunday night which was much quieter and got a table in the bar. Again we ordered garlic bread and then pie & chips and chicken on tagliatelle. Personally I found the pastry the pie was in a bit on the heavy side (possibly slightly undercooked?) and I suspect the vegetables we had may have been cooked for sunday lunch and then reheated for us, but the food was very tasty and piping hot, the chips with the pie were delicious, hot and crispy.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We decided to share a cheeseboard for pudding and this was very nice. There were 2 fruity Wensleydale cheeses, which I found a bit repetitive, but as we were only round the corner from the Hawes Creamery where its made, maybe that was to be expected.....
reviews.title: Fantastic food and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both times the service was very friendly and the price of the food was very competitive (£28 for a starter, 2 mains and a dessert).
reviews.title: nice food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surroundings are very pleasant and the bar staff are very friendly. We will definately return
reviews.title: A Cut Above

description: In September 2011 Pat & Matthew Kirkbride took over The White Hart Country Inn, Hawes. After a HUGE renovation the bar opened for drinks only in October 2011 followed shortly after by food in December 2011. Work is now completed on the refurbishment of our luxury bedrooms. We have three king-size doubles and two twins, all with modern en-suite facilities, plasma screen TV/DVD players, WiFi throughout and tea and coffee making facilities.
